name: Stress

description:
💎 Egg: Stress
⚙️ Version: 1.5
 What: This Egg will stress your machine (I recommend using it if you have any Oracle VM, if your VM stays unused for a long time, your account will be suspended)
🐛 Fixed bugs/changelogs: 
 • (1.2) Initialization fixed.
 • (1.3) Docker Changed.
 • (1.4) Install Script fixed
 • (1.5) Stop command fixed
• ️ Warning: Use with care!

variables.name: Stress CPU
variables.description: This will enable CPU stress only, This will add the argument (--cpu)

variables.name: CPU + RAM Stress
variables.description: This will enable the argument (--vm) + (--vm-bytes), Disable CPU Stress for this to work properly.

variables.name: CPU Cores
variables.description: How many cores do you want to stress?

variables.name: RAM memory
variables.description: Put here in MB, how much RAM will be stressed.

variables.name: Metrics
variables.description: enable metrics and show only non-null results. (--metrics-brief)

variables.name: Runtime
variables.description: Time the command will run in seconds. If not specified, will run for 1 Day (--timeout 30s)

variables.name: Use your arguments?
variables.description: Enable the use of your arguments

variables.name: Your Arguments
variables.description: If you want to enter your own arguments, see the stress-ng Wiki: https://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/bionic/man1/stress-ng.1. html
